div1.p: North describes where his regiment is camped and praises his Lieutenant Trout.

This is a very desolate looking country. no fences of any account some of the houses are torn down and others are not disturbed. there are two very fine residences one on each side of our camp we get water at either. the one is a union family and they have a fine orchard & flowers garden, and yards. it is a grand old residence and nothing is disturbed. the inmates of the other have left. part of the house has been used for a stable part for head quarters. the windows are broken and the fluid is the common property of the men. the fields all
over the part of the country we are in are all open and look as if they had never been fenced here and there you may see a small patch of corn but I have seen but two fenced fields you seldom see any one but soldiers. we are passing over the same ground which McClellans grand army passed over last winter. Camp life is very pleasant so far there is so much variety and so much company that a person can not help being cheerful. I wish you were here to eat with us we can cook as good a dinner as any man need want we take pride in having every thing nice. Tell the girls there is no
use in trying to scare us with the idea of bachelors hall for we have tried it and get along very well the worst part is washing dishes we often sleep in the middle of the day for one half hour or an hour. we only drill in the morning and evening. Maj. Hershbarger is here drilling the officers. I expect you cant read this writing, but I am writing with my paper in one hand and pen in the other and the boys are talking all the time so you will have to make some allowanse. Cook sends his best respects to you and says you must write all the news the rest of our family Liz Boyd Bruce
Parkers boys McCune (cake bakers son) are all well and hearty I think I will stop till I see whether I get any news from home to night. Aug 26 I have not got a letter yet. there isI got a Valley Star from Neuville. Capt has not received his trunk yet but I think he will get it soon. Jacob is well and doing well he is drilling a squad sometimes cooking & so on DrLieutenant Trout is the kindest officer we have. the mail man is coming I must stop.
